page.title: 08GREENS NORTON PARK FARM
page.content: This is the largest farm in the area and is a mixed farm owned by Mr.Roger Allebone.The 500 acres is divided between arable land and land used for the dairy herd of Freisian cattle,milk from which is sold direct to the Milk Marketing Board.Beef production on the farm means that cattle are sold in the local markets.Mr Allebone also rents another 200 acres of land for similar purposes.Milking is done twice daily in a milking parlour.He employs three men,one of whom is in charge of the dairy herd.To help him in his work he has six tractors,combine harvester and all the usual farm machinery.He says that he does not mind people using the Knightley Way which cuts directly through his land,but is upset by horse riders who damage his crops.
